intro: Piratinera scabridula, commonly known as the rough piratinera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves that are typically grayish-green in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
